cheatsheet.title: Getting started with information security assessments

intro.description:
Welcome to verinice information security assessments!
This tutorial will help you to conduct your first information security assessment!

item.title: Switch to the security assessment perspective
item.description:
First you have to create a new security assessment. You should be in the security assessment perspective. If not, you can go there by choosing from the menu: View -> Show Perspective... -> Security Assessment Perspective.
You will find the security assessment view on left side of the Window.

item.title: Create a new security assessment
item.description:
Click the NEW button in the security assessment view or choose from the menu: File -> Add new security assessment
The new security assessment will appear in the view. Double-click on it to bring up the editor view. Change the name from "[My Company]" to your actual company's name.
Save by clicking on File -> Save or by pressing the keys Ctrl-S.

item.title: Open the first category
item.description:
Expand the security assessment by clicking the small arrow to the left of the node's icon. Expand "Controls" and then the first category by clicking the small arrow on the left.
You should be able to see a number of categories from "Security Policy" to "Access Control". These categories contain questions that will help you to evaluate your current information security level for the most important topics.

item.title: Answering questions
item.description:
Double-click on the first question to open the editor. Simultaneously, the Object Browser will show you the question and a selection of maturity levels.
Read the descriptions to decide which maturity level you have reached in your organization. You may have to consult other employees or do some internal research to answer the question correctly.
Choose the correct maturity level in the editor below the browser view. You can also add a public comment. This comment will be included in a database export. You can also add a private comment just for yourself. The private comment will always stay in your local database.
Save your changes by pressing Ctrl-S or by choosing File -> Save.

item.title: Generate a report
item.description:
Continue in the same way with the next question. As you go along, you will notice that the spider chart in the bottom left corner of the screen begins to reflect your answers. When you have answered all questions honestly, you will have a good overview about your current information security situation.
When you are done answering all questions, you may want to generate a report for management or another party, which you can then send them by e-mail or other means. You can do so by choosing File -> Security Assessment -> Generate Report....
Choose the type of report and a filename under which the report should be saved, then click OK.

item.title: Export results
item.description:
When you are done answering all questions, you can export your results to send them to another party. You can do so by clicking the EXPORT button in the security assessment view.
You have to choose a filename under which the report will be saved. The exported file is always encrypted, so you also have to choose a password or a certificate for encryption. Once you're done, press OK.

item.title: Finished
item.description:
Congratulations on conducting your first security assessment of your information security status. If you wish to go further and are thinking about actually establishing an information security management system (ISMS) in your company, you can go back to the welcome screen by choosing Help -> Welcome.
This time, select the option "Establish an ISMS". You will be directed to the ISM Perspective with another tutorial to guide you.
item.onCompletion: This concludes this tutorial. Don't forget to go to http://verinice.org for more information and news!
